page.title: 04School - Shelton Primary
page.content: At Shelton School{42 pupils}are taught in a Victorian style buiding with very large and high windows. The brick building is crowned with a bell tower and is surrounded by a small playground and there is a games field on the other side of the road. It is one if the few schools remaining in South Norfolk with outside toilets. { { Pupils are drawn from the villages {of Shelton, Hardwick and Fritton.}The day begins at 9.00am with a lesson of English or Mathematics. There is a 15 minute break in the morning and this is usually followed by a period of creative writing. After a lunch break of one hour the pupils are usually engaged on projects in History, Geography or Science. Infants and juniors work together and a headteacher with one assistant preside. The day ends with a story.
